Class ObjectList

java.lang.Object
  ObjectList
All Implemented Interfaces:
ObjectListInterface
public class ObjectList
extends java.lang.Object
implements ObjectListInterface

This Class contains methods that deal with Objects stored in a list. It uses nodes to keep track, modify and erase objects from the list, and since every node has a both next and previous field ,this implementation is of a doubly-linked linkedList It keeps track of the currentPosition of an object in a list that may contain many objects. It further modifies the current position when some operations take place which change the current object. These operations include the internal iterators such as getNext, getLast, getFirst, getLast. Furthermore, methods such as insert, append, remove, replace, allow us to change the Objects in a particular instance of a list. While append always inserts an object at the end of the list, and thus is not affected by the current position or the current Object, insert, remove and replace all depend on the current Object. Lastly, we have a clear method as well which can completely empty the list.

Version:
03/01/14

Omair Alam

Constructor Detail

ObjectList

public ObjectList()
The default constructor for the ObjectList class. It sets the headNode to null and all the integer data fields to 0.

Method Detail

append

public boolean append(java.lang.Object newObject)
Places the provided Object at the end of the list. Makes newObject the currentObject, thus also makes currentPosition the last position in the list.

Specified by:
append in interface ObjectListInterface
Parameters:
newObject - The object we want to add to the end of the list
Returns:
True because the placement of the object at the end of the list is always successfull.

clear

public boolean clear()
Removes all Objects from the list by removing the reference of the headNode. Returns true regardless of whether the list is initally empty or not.

Specified by:
clear in interface ObjectListInterface
Returns:
True since the headNode can be made null at any time

display

public void display()
Prints the objects in our list, starting from the first to the last object.

getCurrent

public java.lang.Object getCurrent()
Return the object at the current position, or null if the list is empty, since in that case there would be no objects.

Specified by:
getCurrent in interface ObjectListInterface
Returns:
The object at the current position, or null if there is no current object

getCurrentPosition

public int getCurrentPosition()
Returns the index (between 0 and n) of the pointer (0 if the list is empty) which is at current Position, i.e returns the position of the object that we are at in the list

Specified by:
getCurrentPosition in interface ObjectListInterface
Returns:
The current position that we are at.

Move to the last position of the list and returns the object associated with that position (if any) or null if the list is empty.

public int getLength()
Returns the number of objects in our list.

Specified by:
getLength in interface ObjectListInterface
Returns:
The number of objects in our list.

getNext

public java.lang.Object getNext()
Moves to the next position in the list and returns the object associated with that position. If we are at the end of the list, the method will return the last object in the list. If the list is empty. the method will return null since there is no object at any position.

Specified by:
getNext in interface ObjectListInterface
Returns:
The next object in the list (or null if the list is empty)

getPrevious

public java.lang.Object getPrevious()
Move to the previous position in the list and return the object associated with that position. If we are currently at the beginning of the list, the method will return the object at the beginning of the list. If the list is empty, the method will return null, since there is no object at any position

Specified by:
getPrevious in interface ObjectListInterface
Returns:
The previous object in the list (or null if the list is empty)

insert

public boolean insert(java.lang.Object newObject)
Places the provided Object into the list before the current object (meaning at a position before currentPosition). Set new object to be current object.

Specified by:
insert in interface ObjectListInterface
Parameters:
newObject - The object that we want to place in the position of the current object.
Returns:
True because the object can be successfully inserted at the specified position always

remove

public java.lang.Object remove()
Removes and returns the object at the current position of the list(if any exist). Therefore if the list is empty, null is returned. By default the previous object becomes the current object except for in the case when the object being removed is the first object. In this case the next object becomes the current object.

Specified by:
remove in interface ObjectListInterface
Returns:
The current object that was removed

replace

public boolean replace(java.lang.Object newObject)
Replaces the Object in the current position with the provided newObject. If the list is empty, there is no object to replace so the method returns false

Specified by:
replace in interface ObjectListInterface
Parameters:
newObject - The object that we want to replace the object at current position with return True or False depending upon whether the replacement was successful or not respectfully, meaning whether there was an object to replace or the list was empty.
